Sergio Micco: "Estamos frente a violaciones graves a los DD.HH."
El director del INDH confrontó sus propias palabras del pasado domingo, donde aseguró que no existe una "violación sistemática" de los derechos humanos.
05 Nov 2019 by Gonzalo Miranda
Causaron indignación y molestia en el instituto y organizaciones de Derechos Humanos. Las declaraciones de Sergio Micco, presidente del Instituto Nacional de Derechos Humanos (INDH), aseguró el pasado domingo que en Chile no existe una "violación sistemática" de los DD.HH.
Tras sus palabras en Mesa Central de Canal 13, el abogado enfrentó a la Comisión de Derechos Humanos del Senado y tuvo que medir sus palabras: "estamos frente a violaciones graves a los DD.HH.", dijo Micco.
"Si estamos frente a la sistematicidad o no de estas violaciones de DD.HH., lo que hemos dicho es que, no estamos en condiciones de afirmar que existe esta sistematicidad, pero tampoco es oportuno descartarlo, siendo esto materia de las posteriores investigaciones que hará el instituto y obviamente los tribunales de justicia", agregpo frente a la Comisión.
Dichas aseveranciones se contradicen a las que emitió el pasado domingo, donde aseguró que dichas "violaciones sistemáticas" no han pasado: "si tú me preguntas a mí, como director del INDH, yo te diría que no existen y quien afirme lo contrario tiene que probarlo", comentó en esa oportunidad.
Aquello desató la molestia de distintos organismos, las que fueron encabezadas por la Asociación Nacional de Funcionarios Defensoras y Defensores de (INDH): "manifestamos nuestro profundo desacuerdo con los dichos del director respecto al trabajo realizado por nuestros funcionarios y funcionarias, quitándole total respaldo a nuestra labor de observación al señalar que hemos perdido 'imparcialidad'".
text:
Sergio Micco: "We are facing serious violations of human rights."
The director of the NHRI confronted his own words last Sunday, where he said there is no "systematic violation" of human rights.
05 Nov 2019 by Gonzalo Miranda
They caused outrage and annoyance at the institute and Human Rights organizations. The statements of Sergio Micco, president of the National Institute of Human Rights (NHRI), said last Sunday that in Chile there is no "systematic violation" of human rights.
Following his words at the Mesa Mesa de Canal 13, the lawyer confronted the Senate Human Rights Commission and had to measure his words: "we are facing serious violations of human rights," said Micco.
"If we are facing the systematity or not of these human rights violations, what we have said is that, we are not in a position to affirm that this systematicity exists, but it is also not appropriate to rule it out, this being the subject of subsequent investigations that the institute will do and obviously the courts of justice, "he added to the Commission.
These statements contradict those he issued last Sunday, where he said that these "systematic violations" have not happened: "If you ask me, as director of the NHRI, I would tell you that they do not exist and whoever claims otherwise has to try it, "he said on that occasion.
That unleashed the annoyance of different organizations, which were headed by the National Association of Human Rights Defenders and Defenders of (INDH): "we express our deep disagreement with the director's sayings regarding the work done by our officials and civil servants, taking total support from our observation work by pointing out that we have lost 'impartiality'. "
